meta_description: Journey through 5,000 years of human creativity, from Monet to contemporaries like Mickalene Thomas. Considered one of the finest regional art museums in the country, the Memorial Art Gallery is known for its comprehensive, well-balanced collection and dynamic schedule of exhibitions year-round.
hours_text:
## Hours

## Hours

### Museum Galleries

**Wednesday–Sunday:**  
11:00 am–5:00 pm  
**Thursday & Second Fridays:**  
11:00 am–8:00 pm  
**Monday & Tuesday:**  
CLOSED

### THE STORE @ MAG

**Wednesday–Sunday:**  
11:00 am–5:00 pm  
**Thursday & Second Fridays:**  
11:00 am–8:00 pm  
**Monday & Tuesday:**  
CLOSED

### Creative Workshop

**Monday–Friday:**  
9:00 am–5:00 pm  
Classes and events as scheduled

### Library

**Monday–Wednesday:**  
[By appointment](https://app.smartsheet.com/b/form/d66fb299c53242f7ab29c129a3e7e4da)  
**Thursday & Friday:**  
12:00–5:00 pm

### Administrative Offices

**Monday–Friday:**  
Regular business hours

The building and museum are CLOSED on major holidays: New Year’s Day, Martin Luther King Jr. Day, Memorial Day, Juneteenth, Fourth of July, Labor Day, Thanksgiving, and Christmas Day.

The building closes at 3 pm on Christmas Eve, and at 5 pm on New Year’s Eve. The museum closes at the same times, if those days fall during normal museum hours (Wednesday–Sunday).
admission_text:
## Admission

## Admission

$20| Adults  
---|---  
$18| Senior Citizens (Age 62+)  
$9| College Students with ID  
Children Age 6-18  
Free| MAG Members  
Children Age 5 and Under  
Half-Price  
Admission| Thursdays and Second Fridays after 5 pm  
  
MAG offers free access to children age 5 and under, active University of Rochester students*, faculty, staff & retirees, and SNAP card holders (along with three guests).

[Members’ Tickets](http://586.blackbaudhosting.com/586/tickets?tab=3&txobjid=177aa9eb-d04c-4350-9f19-a76242620cd2)

[Not-Yet-Members’ Tickets](http://586.blackbaudhosting.com/586/tickets?tab=3&txobjid=ed326253-adc2-4aa7-b82e-6570a0c9f187)

[Become a Member](https://mag.rochester.edu/join/)

Admission Discounts

### Half-Price Thursday and Friday Evenings

Admission is half-price every Thursday and on the second Friday of each month from 5:00 to 8:00 pm. Half-price tickets are available online as well as on-site, and are only valid after 5:00 pm on the selected day.

### Discount for Ordering Online

There is a $2 discount on all general admission tickets when ordering online, applied at checkout! This discount is not applied to tickets for the guests of MAG Members, which are already 50% off.

Free Admission Opportunities

### MAG Members

Members always get free admission, and 50% off guest admission. These tickets and discounts are available online as well as on-site at the Admissions Desk.

### Kids Age 5 and Under

Admission is always free for children age ...
accessibility_text:
The Memorial Art Gallery welcomes all visitors to experience and enjoy its collections, exhibitions, buildings, and grounds. Additionally, we are committed to offering programs and services that are accessible to everyone. This includes our events rooms, the auditorium, the Creative Workshop, and THE STORE @ MAG.

## Accessibility Requests

ASL Interpretation

Public programs, classes, and tours are interpreted upon request. To best ensure we can accommodate your request, please email [access@mag.rochester.edu](mailto:access@mag.rochester.edu) two weeks in advance, with the name of the program in the subject line of your email.

Experiences for Blind and Partially-Sighted Individuals

MAG offers experiences for individuals who are blind or partially sighted upon request. To schedule an experience, please contact [tours@mag.rochester.edu](mailto:tours@mag.rochester.edu).

All are invited to touch the artwork in the Centennial Sculpture Park.

## Visiting MAG

Audio Descriptions

The Memorial Art Gallery offers audio descriptions of selected works of art in our collection to visitors. These descriptions are available as a tour in our [digital guide](https://mag.rochester.edu/visit/digital-guide/).

Elevators

There are two elevators in the building. One is located at the far end of the museum galleries, next to the stairs, and provides access to the second floor of the museum. The second is located in the pavilion, near the coatroom, and provides access to the Creative Workshop...
